speaker: 9 system hours until Charmony Festival - Golden Hour
Sunday
line: "When I appeared as a child, my speech, mindset, and soul reflected immaturity and innocence."

speaker: Sunday
line: "As I grew into adulthood, I left behind my childlike side."

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission The Only Path to Tomorrow.mp4

speaker: HalovianServant
line: I humbly request your blessings, esteemed advocate of Xipe .

speaker: Sunday
line: Come to me, my Kinship. I have sought THEIR presence with us.

speaker: Halovian Servant
line: As you wish.

speaker: Halovian Servant
line: I have faithfully served the Alfalfa Family for nearly a decade, promoting the Path of the Harmony to the best of my ability. However, I made a mistake yesterday. While I was preparing dinner for The Family Head , I accidentally dropped a prepared dish on the floor.

speaker: Halovian Servant
line: Out of laziness, I lied and claimed that everything was ready. Although the Head has dismissed me as punishment, it has been tough to sleep with the guilt still gnawing at me, as I worried that the seeds of evilness may have taken root in my soul. So, I confess to you now to seek atonement for my sins.

speaker: Sunday
line: Do you sincerely repent and vow to change your ways?

speaker: Halovian Servant
line: Yes.

speaker: Sunday
line: Have you examined your soul and confessed all your sins?

speaker: Halovian Servant
line: Yes.

speaker: Sunday
line: Are you willing to accept the process of atonement?

speaker: Halovian Servant
line: Yes.

speaker: Sunday
line: Very well. Show your dedication and goodwill to The Family , and you shall be reinstated among them. Now, please leave in peace.

speaker: Halovian Servant
line: Praise Xipe. And thank you, esteemed advocate.

speaker: Sunday
line: ...Next. Please step forward.

speaker: Panicked Dreamchaser
line: I... I wholeheartedly confess to you... Please, pardon my sins!

speaker: Sunday
line: Rest assured. I have implored THEIR presence to be with us. As long as you are sincere, absolution will be granted.

speaker: Panicked Dreamchaser
line: Oh! Oh, great... you know, I... I arrived in Penacony as a stowaway. I sold everything to get a ticket... my house, my land... and... my two children...

speaker: Sunday
line: I see... Please go on.

speaker: Panicked Dreamchaser
line: My children were starving, and I hoped they'd have a chance at survival if they became slaves here. If... if I can strike it rich here, I'll lift them out of that situation... and give them the life they deserve...

speaker: Panicked Dreamchaser
line: But, but, the Bloodhound Family got wind of it. They're on my tail... hunting me down... I thought I could bring my kids here! It was all my fault... all my fault...

speaker: Sunday
line: The Family is ready to forgive all sinners. I'll ask the Bloodhound Family to cease their pursuit. You don't need to live in fear anymore.

speaker: Panicked Dreamchaser
line: Thank you, thank you! I'll work my hardest to redeem my children and make them part of The Family... P—Praise the Harmony!

speaker: Sunday
line: ...Next. Please step forward.

speaker: PepeshiMerchant
line: Hey, long time no see, Mr. Sunday! The most esteemed individual in Penacony and... the next leader of the Oak Family, right?

speaker: Sunday
line: ...I have sought THEIR presence with us. Let us proceed.

speaker: Pepeshi Merchant
line: Sure, let's just get this over with. Ahem! I have sinned. Please forgive me! I wasted half a pizza at breakfast... and a bottle of SoulGlad.

speaker: Pepeshi Merchant
line: That's it. Nothing more. Can we wrap this up? I've got a Roboball game to catch, you know?

speaker: Sunday
line: Do you... seek to atone for your sins through good deeds?

speaker: Pepeshi Merchant
line: My "sins"!? Starting to sound like a saint, eh? Let me tell you something — Neither The Family nor you have the right to judge me.

speaker: Pepeshi Merchant
line: You think nobody knows what your precious Family has done? About the Watchmaker , huh? Don't kid yourself, feather-brain. Those Dreamchasers might be fooled by your act, but don't fool yourself.

speaker: Pepeshi Merchant
line: Before you start spouting off your holy verses, answer me this... Where does the power of the Oak Family come from? And your power? What makes you think you can sit there, all high and mighty, looking down on everyone else?

speaker: Pepeshi Merchant
line: Well, I've spent enough time in confession today to enter the Harmony's paradise, right? Then I'll take my leave. Good luck with your election, and... don't make me regret my investments in you.

speaker: Sunday
line: O, revered Triple-Faced Soul, hear my doubts...

speaker: Sunday
line: Who can judge the strong when their power hides their crimes?

speaker: Sunday
line: Who can vouch for the weak when they will pay any price to survive?

speaker: Sunday
line: Who can comfort the purest souls when even they get led astray?

speaker: Sunday
line: If "the strong defending the weak" is truly the foundation of paradise...

speaker: Sunday
line: ...then who— who is responsible for the suffering and anguish in this wretched world?

speaker: Robin
line: Brother... Brother...?

speaker: Robin
line: ...Brother? Are you alright?

speaker: Sunday
line: ...I'm fine. I've been working long hours, and I just made a trip to Dreamflux Reef and back... So I'm a bit out of sorts. But it'll all be over before we know it.

speaker: Welt
line: You've been working non-stop on the Charmony Festival, Mr. Sunday, and no one could have predicted this incident. Even if the Stellaron does pose a grave threat, I still feel sorry for all the trouble we've caused you.

speaker: Sunday
line: Hehe, no need to worry about troubling anyone. The Charmony Festival was meant to spread joy and harmony across the Cosmos. But now that we know the truth, I'm afraid we'll have to cancel it.

speaker: Robin
line: It has always been our wish to make everyone happy, so... we'll do our best to explain everything to the Dreammaster. I'm sure he'll understand.

speaker: Robin
line: Even if the negotiation does not go smoothly... I'll refuse to go on stage. Without the Chordmaster, the Harmonious Choir would not arrive, and the Charmony Festival would be just a grand performance, and nothing more.

speaker: Welt
line: I'm relieved to see your determination.

speaker: Welt
line: Y'know, since arriving in Penacony, we haven't had any contact with this Dreammaster himself. I'd heard of the heads of the five major lineages, but the Dreammaster is a mystery to me.

speaker: Sunday
line: The Dreammaster rarely grants an audience — even for us. But given the urgency of the situation, he's agreed to meet us in person.

speaker: Robin
line: Perhaps you'll be the first guest to meet the Dreammaster in years, Mr. Yang.

speaker: Welt
line: Let's hope we can reach a consensus that satisfies everyone.

speaker: Sunday
line: Indeed — let us hope so.

speaker: Robin
line: It's about time. We'll have to get ready for the meeting... I apologize for any inconvenience caused by the urgency.

speaker: Welt
line: Don't worry. I'll be waiting here.

title: Mission Description
content: You and theAstral ExpressVIPs have arrived at the agreed location. As is convention, the "Dreammaster's" arrival demands a designated escort to greet them. This crucial mission has fallen on your shoulders.In the distance, you happen to hear someone calling for help. There is still time until the Dreammaster's scheduled arrival... Perhaps you have time to go and investigate.

speaker: Drunken Guest
line: Oh, dear... it's Mr. Sunday! Hey, come over here! Hahaha...

speaker: Sunday
line: Looks like someone needs help... let's go check it out.

speaker: Welt
line: Thank you for everything you've done. I'll be waiting here.

speaker: Drunken Guest
line: Oh, Mr. Sunday... Hey there! Okay, see the moon in the sky? It's about the size of the cap on my SoulGlad bottle!

speaker: Drunken Guest
line: If I just reached out my hand... I could grab the moon, couldn't I?

speaker: Sunday
line: The moon... You mean the Grand Theater ?

speaker: Drunken Guest
line: Oh, yeah! Haha, look at me! I've been away from home for too long... I must be missing that moon... *hiccup*

speaker: Drunken Guest
line: But... it's no big deal! The Grand Theater here looks much better than the moon back home... It's just... magnificent!

speaker: Drunken Guest
line: They told me not to sell everything I had just to come to Penacony... Tsk, how short-sighted!

speaker: Robin
line: Selling everything you had? Why would you go to such lengths?

speaker: Drunken Guest
line: Why? Can't you see...? Life back home is miserable... It's not really living at all.

speaker: Drunken Guest
line: It's better to be here in Penacony! No pain, no worries about tomorrow, just sweet dreams! You can do whatever you want! That's what I call living... *hiccup* Yeah, now this is the life!

speaker: Robin
line: Is this... truly "living"...?

speaker: Drunken Guest
line: *hiccup* Huh...? What did you just say, young lady...? I didn't quite catch that...

speaker: Sunday
line: Oh, it's nothing, sir. You see, the traffic on Glaux Avenue can be dangerous. How about I ask a Bloodhound Family member to escort you to Aideen Park over there so you can continue enjoying your sweet dream?

speaker: Drunken Guest
line: Oh... yeah, that's a great idea! Wow, no wonder you're the leader of this sweet dream! You're totally a lifesaver!

speaker: Drunken Guest
line: See you around, Mr. Sunday! And... It was nice chatting with you... *hiccup*

speaker: Sunday
line: What's up, sister?

speaker: Robin
line: This is the land of the dreams, but why do they live like this?

speaker: Robin
line: The man we ran into... he doesn't seem happy at all.

speaker: Robin
line: Even though sweet dreams are nice, they're just illusions. But for him, they're the only way to survive, even if it means giving up on reality... That's not really living at all.

speaker: Sunday
line: I suppose you have a point... but in my opinion, that's how most people live their lives.

speaker: Robin
line: ...Why do you say that?

speaker: Sunday
line: You think that man is not actually "living," but that's not quite accurate. Even without Penacony, people create their own illusions called "self-value."

speaker: Sunday
line: People believe they have a predetermined value to fulfill. Gaining value means gaining power, and those deemed worthless are seen as the weak.

speaker: Sunday
line: However, value doesn't come out of thin air, and there's a limit to it. To accumulate value, people have to take from others. So, the weak get exploited and oppressed...

speaker: Robin
line: Are you suggesting that... this is not how things should be?

speaker: Sunday
line: Exactly, but ironically, people don't think there's anything wrong with it, because they uphold the illusory notion of self-value, and even the weak believe in it.

speaker: Sunday
line: Survival of the fittest... that's where all the tragedies in the world come from. People come to the sweet dream in Penacony to escape from that reality and find solace.

speaker: Sunday
line: No tragedies exist here, only happiness, although in its nascent form. Isn't that the same paradise we yearn for in our dreams?

speaker: Robin
line: Perhaps that man is just an exception. Let's not jump to conclusions. We should experience the Dreamscape ourselves, just as I did at Dreamflux Reef.

speaker: Sunday
line: Yes, seeing is believing. I'll accompany you. The Dreammaster hasn't shown up yet, so we have some time for a stroll.

text: Learn more about the dream before the Dreammaster's arrival

title: Step Description
content: The drunken guest stumbles unsteadily as they disappear into the depths of the dream. As you watch his figure from behind, you fall into deep reflection: Is it really right to rely on something as intangible and invisible as a fantasy as your only option in life?Seeing your concern, Sunday suggests exploring the area before the Dreammaster arrives... Perhaps, there will be an answer to your doubts to be found?

speaker: Cheerful Guest
line: Glad to meet you again, Robin! How are the preparations for the Charmony Festival coming along? We're all so excited about it!

speaker: Robin
line: It's going smoothly. Thanks for making the trip to join the Festival.

speaker: Cheerful Guest
line: You're too kind, Robin. It's a pleasure to have guests from all over the universe celebrating day and night!

speaker: Cheerful Guest
line: I can't stand being lonely or bored, so this jubilant Dreamscape is perfect for me.

speaker: Robin
line: But if this went on forever... would it get boring too?

speaker: Cheerful Guest
line: Nah, not at all! Who would get tired of having so much fun?

speaker: Cheerful Guest
line: Every day, you get to wear fancy clothes, explore all sorts of dream bubbles, indulge in delicious food without gaining weight, and you never get old or sick... As long as you can afford a room, this place is the ultimate paradise!

speaker: Robin
line: But... you know that only a few things can be brought back from the Dreamscape to reality, right?

speaker: Cheerful Guest
line: That's exactly why I don't plan on bringing anything back! Just enjoying the dream itself is good enough for me! I mean, I'm not one of those long-living species. I only have around sixty or seventy years in this lifetime, and there's so much to worry about... Being happy here is pure bliss.

speaker: Cheerful Guest
line: Only in this sweet dream can I truly feel like I'm in control of my life and fate... Who would want to go back to reality after experiencing this bliss?

speaker: Robin
line: ...I see. I genuinely wish you all the happiness in the world.

speaker: Cheerful Guest
line: And I wish you a fantastic performance, Robin! I'm off to the Blue Hour for the ball. See you later!

speaker: Robin
line: *sigh*

speaker: Sunday
line: Seems like that guest's perspective didn't resonate with you either.

speaker: Robin
line: She had a valid point, and I could sense her genuine happiness. It's just that...

speaker: Sunday
line: What you're trying to say is... she thinks she's in control of her life, but in reality, she's just escaping from reality and seeking solace in this sweet dream. Once she steps out of this sanctuary, everything will be lost.

speaker: Robin
line: Well, she did make mention of being able to "afford a room"... didn't she?

speaker: Sunday
line: However, the paradise in our dreams... it doesn't have to end.

speaker: Robin
line: No, and the paradise we yearn for... shouldn't be just a fleeting dream either.

text: Continue to learn more about the dream before the Dreammaster's arrival

speaker: Robin
line: The scenery in this Dreamscape is truly breathtaking, isn't it?

speaker: Quiet Guest
line: Oh, Robin? Can't believe I'm meeting you in person here... What an honor.

speaker: Quiet Guest
line: You're right. Even though time stands still in this Dreamscape, it always feels fresh... I find something new every time.

speaker: Robin
line: A philosophical mind... I hope I'm not intruding.

speaker: Quiet Guest
line: Not at all. With little time left, I yearn for meaningful conversations, especially with someone as esteemed as you. Do you mind if we chat?

speaker: Robin
line: It's my pleasure. No need to be formal — just speak your mind. You said "with little time left"... Please forgive me for being blunt, but is that why you came to Penacony?

speaker: Quiet Guest
line: Hehe, yeah... I was part of a war, and while escaping from the Sukhousian mothership, I got exposed to some radioactive materials.

speaker: Quiet Guest
line: And then? All my comrades died, and my hometown was wiped out by neutron bombardments. I couldn't bear to live with everything I knew gone... That's when I heard about a possible solution here, so I came.

speaker: Robin
line: How heart-wrenching... I hope The Family has been able to help you.

speaker: Quiet Guest
line: They have, and I'm truly grateful for that. They provided me with a comfortable room, the most advanced life-support devices in the Cosmos, and a stellar team of caregivers.

speaker: Quiet Guest
line: My physical body is now in the Dreampool, sustained by life support. The me you see here is whole, rational, and no different from any other person... but I can't say the same for the "me" in the hotel room.

speaker: Quiet Guest
line: My true appearance... Well, I hope you never have to witness it, Robin.

speaker: Robin
line: So... you'll be living forever in this Dreamscape, right?

speaker: Quiet Guest
line: Heh, just being able to live at all is good enough for me. Whether it's in this Dreamscape or not, well, I don't really have much say in the matter.

speaker: Quiet Guest
line: My world has been torn apart, and my life could end any second. So... even if this whole place is an illusion, it's still my paradise, and I'll treasure every moment I spend here.

speaker: Quiet Guest
line: Heh... how I envy those everlasting things...

speaker: Robin
line: That old man's story... it's so tragic. Fortunately, this sweet dream gives him joyful memories to hold onto for the rest of his life.

speaker: Sunday
line: That's precisely why this sweet dream in Penacony exists.

speaker: Robin
line: However, even the sweet dream has its limitations. While it provides solace to the disillusioned, it can't completely eliminate pain in reality.

speaker: Sunday
line: There will be a way out. Penacony is already on the right track.

title: Step Description
content: During your exploration, you encounter an eye-catching woman... She is disguised as you and strutting brazenly down Glaux Avenue. You cannot fathom what kind of scheme she is brewing.For the sake of Penacony and to protect your identity, you must have a firm discussion with her.

line: Look who we have here? A lovely young lady.

speaker: Robin
line: Wait, is that... me?
Brother! What a surprise to see you again.

speaker: Sunday
line: Show yourself. Your trick won't work on us.

speaker: Robin
line: I've heard that a skilled Masked Fool received an invitation too... That must be you, right? Did you enjoy yourself?

speaker: Sparkle
line: Barely. The people here are way too gullible. A little bait is all it takes for them to bite, and they run away at the slightest hint of danger. In other words, they're naive and cowardly!

speaker: Robin
line: Now that you've had your fill, it'd be wise to leave before it's too late. The music of the Harmony doesn't tolerate discord.

speaker: Sparkle
line: What? Now that you have the real Robin, I'm useless? Oh, how disheartening! I've done so much for The Family.

speaker: Sparkle
line: You should be thanking me because if it weren't for me cleaning up this mess... Penacony would still be in shambles. Don't you think?

speaker: Sunday
line: That was a personal request from the head of the Iris Family , and it has nothing to do with us. Step aside and stop causing trouble for the Charmony Festival.

speaker: Sparkle
line: The Charmony Festival? Heh, you think you can scare me? You think I've no idea what you're planning?

speaker: Sparkle
line: I don't care what you're thinking, chicken wing boy, but I'm pretty sure our lovely Robin won't be appearing on stage. After all, you're well aware of what a sorry state this Dreamscape is in under the banner of Harmony...

speaker: Sparkle
line: Penacony, the Land of the Dreams... is this truly the paradise you desire?

speaker: Sunday
line: ...Stop it!

speaker: Sparkle
line: What's the rush, chicken wing boy? Did I get to you?

speaker: Robin
line: Our paradise is none of your concern, Masked Fool. Leave now, or The Family won't tolerate you anymore.

speaker: Sparkle
line: Alright, alright. I'll go, but Robin, I suggest you seriously consider this...

speaker: Sparkle
line: ...Do you really believe those living in dreams can escape pain and find true happiness?

speaker: Sparkle
line: Well, I've done my part, and now I'm simply waiting for the fireworks to begin.

speaker: Sparkle
line: Here, the last two gifts for both of you, and don't lose them. If, by some unfortunate chance, the Charmony Festival starts against all odds... remember to use them during the show.

speaker: Sparkle
line: And it'll be thrilling! Bang!

title: Step Description
content: You chase off the Masked Fool who revels in chaos and hear a murmuring of ravens coming from the distant skies... The "Dreammaster" has come, that you are certain.For the sake of Penacony's future, go forth and greet this past benefactor.

speaker: Sunday
line: I heard a raven cawing in the distance... It seems the Dreammaster will arrive soon.

speaker: Sunday
line: Let's wait here for the Dreammaster to arrive.

speaker: Robin
line: Okay. By the way, brother, I heard you no longer have a sweet tooth. Back when we were kids, you used to steal my desserts...

speaker: Robin
line: Seems like a lot has changed during my absence. What exactly happened?

speaker: Sunday
line: Well, someone has to stay awake even in this sweet dream.

speaker: Robin
line: But that "someone" doesn't have to be you or anyone in particular. You're carrying too much on your shoulders, brother.

speaker: Robin
line: The paradise in our dreams... it shouldn't be like this.

speaker: Robin
line: Penacony is nothing more than a dream. It can't erase the worries and pain of reality or bring true happiness... It only offers an escape from reality. Nothing more.

speaker: Sunday
line: Remember the old man we met earlier? Without this dream, he might have completely lost himself.

speaker: Robin
line: That might be true, but... even without Penacony, he could have chosen another path. As far as I know, the Intelligentsia Guild has been promoting their rehabilitation techniques for a long time now.

speaker: Robin
line: That path may have been more ordinary and challenging, but now he's in a comatose state, and the "sweet dream" has become a sort of end-of-life care. His fate... is sealed.

speaker: Robin
line: Is Penacony granting these people a future, or is it taking it away from them?

speaker: Sunday
line: Well, don't forget this... not everyone really has a future.

speaker: Sunday
line: The future for humanity is like the sky for birds. People mistakenly believe that flight is inherent to birds because they've never witnessed those birds crashing to their death.

speaker: Sunday
line: Do you remember how we took in that little Charmony Dove when we were young?

speaker: Robin
line: Yeah, we took care of it — provided food and water, and groomed its feathers. And later... when I decided to leave Penacony, I opened the cage and set it free.

speaker: Sunday
line: Well, I didn't mention what happened to it in my letters, because I didn't want to upset you.

speaker: Sunday
line: Shortly after you left, it crashed to its death right in front of your window.

speaker: Robin
line: ...I had surmised as much. I knew you wouldn't have avoided mentioning the bird for no reason.

speaker: Robin
line: Despite that unfortunate outcome, I still believe it was the right decision. Birds aren't meant to spend their lives in cages... They belong in the sky, even if they can't fly.

speaker: Sunday
line: But here's the thing. If there are birds in this world that can never fly, can we really assert that they belong in the sky?

speaker: Robin
line: Are you implying... that the same goes for humans too?

speaker: Sunday
line: Let's take the Astral Express as an example. The Nameless made tremendous efforts to bridge worlds, gaining fame across the universe... However, only a few extraordinary individuals can endure such a perilous journey.

speaker: Sunday
line: That's because the pursuit of the Trailblaze exceeds the capabilities of ordinary humans. Otherwise, why would this Path be filled with broken rails, an abandoned Express, and even a fallen Aeon ?

speaker: Robin
line: That's just sophistry. If that were true, then only the powerful would have the right to determine the future.

speaker: Sunday
line: Unfortunately, that's exactly what happens. Another name for "the future" is "self-value."

speaker: Sunday
line: While this world has its fair share of heroes who inspire people and garner admiration for their heroic deeds, the majority of ordinary people will never become heroes in their lifetime.

speaker: Sunday
line: Some are born weak and vulnerable, some find themselves trapped in unfortunate circumstances, some fall victim to malice and cowardice. When it comes to survival, everyone is equal, and the weak can only watch as their value gets constantly diminished by external forces.

speaker: Robin
line: That's why we should care for the weak and support them as if their suffering were our own... That's what the Odes of Harmony have always taught us.

speaker: Sunday
line: While the Harmony holds noble aspirations, the strong will always be strong, and the weak will always be weak, even in this carefree dream... Human nature contains greatness, but it also harbors inherent weaknesses that can't be eradicated.

speaker: Sunday
line: In the end, if people can't even secure their own survival, they won't care about the illusory future of equality. As long as the law of survival of the fittest prevails... there will always be fledglings crashing to their death.

speaker: Robin
line: But if people don't live for the future, do they merely exist for survival? If even you, my brother, don't believe that the Harmony will save the weak, then which Aeon can make our dreams come true?

speaker: Sunday
line: People often forget that when the first bird took flight, the entire world envisioned a future where...

speaker: Sunday
line: No more fledglings would ever crash to their death.

speaker: Trustful Boy
line: Are you reading, sister? What are you reading?

speaker: Guileless Girl
line: Mr. Gopher Wood gave me a picture book! It's about the story of the Harmonic Strings!

speaker: Guileless Girl
line: If I could become a Chordmaster, I'd like to summon... Dominicus the Harmonious Choir! I want to sing with everyone and spread our wishes so that all can feel happiness and joy.

speaker: Trustful Boy
line: I see. Then... I would summon the Harmonious Choir, too.

speaker: Guileless Girl
line: Don't you... have a wish of your own, brother?

speaker: Trustful Boy
line: Of course, I do. It's just that... it includes your wish and everyone else's. I long for a true paradise where everyone can find peace.

speaker: Guileless Girl
line: Then let's build a stage there and invite everyone to our performance so that both our wishes come true, through the power of the Harmonious Choir.

speaker: Trustful Boy
line: It's a deal then.

speaker: Guileless Girl
line: Yeah, it's a deal! But how can I become a Chordmaster...?

speaker: Sunday
line: Maybe you'll have to become a star first.

text: When you have a chance to make a choice, make one that you know you won't regret.
